Package com.example.mainapplication.datainterface

Class MiddleMan

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.mainapplication.datainterface.MiddleMan
  • public class MiddleMan
extends java.lang.Object
    THE MIDDLE MAN This class is used to get data from the api and from the cache It is also used to store data in the cache ie the middle man between the api and the cache and you. all variables are static so that they can be accessed from anywhere the only thing that is not static is the queue, which is used to make requests in the current context the queue is passed to the constructor, so that it can be used in the current context the main activity is the only class that should be calling the constructor with the storage interface
    Author:
    Ryan Leska

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​Food> foods
      Map of foods, stored in the cache and updated at different times
      private com.android.volley.RequestQueue queue
      Volley queue, used to make requests in the current context
      private static java.util.List<Restaurant> restaurants
      List of restaurants, stored in the cache and updated at different times
      private static StorageInterface storageInterface
      The storage interface is used to store and retrieve data from the cache
      private static int token
      The token is used to authenticate the user, it is stored in the cache and checked on app open to see if the user is still logged in
      private static VolleyQuick volleyQuick
      VolleyQuick is a class that simplifies the use of volley

      MiddleMan​(android.content.Context context)
      The constructor is used to initialize the queue tied to the current context
      MiddleMan​(StorageInterface x, android.content.Context context)
      The constructor is used to initialize the queue and the storage interface the constructor also checks if the user is logged in and updates the restaurants and foods lists

      • token

        private static int token
        The token is used to authenticate the user, it is stored in the cache and checked on app open to see if the user is still logged in

        List of restaurants, stored in the cache and updated at different times

        Map of foods, stored in the cache and updated at different times

        VolleyQuick is a class that simplifies the use of volley
        See Also:
        VolleyQuick

      • queue

        private com.android.volley.RequestQueue queue
        Volley queue, used to make requests in the current context
        Implementation Note:
        changes with new instances of the class

        private static StorageInterface storageInterface
        The storage interface is used to store and retrieve data from the cache
        See Also:
        com.example.mainapplication.datainterface.caching

    • Constructor Detail

      • MiddleMan

        public MiddleMan​(StorageInterface x,
                 android.content.Context context)
        The constructor is used to initialize the queue and the storage interface the constructor also checks if the user is logged in and updates the restaurants and foods lists
        Parameters:
        x - the storage interface to be used to access the cache, can be mocked for testing
        context - the current context
        Implementation Note:
        this constructor is only called by the main activity, and only once for other instances of the class, use the constructor without the storage interface parameter

      • MiddleMan

        public MiddleMan​(android.content.Context context)
        The constructor is used to initialize the queue tied to the current context
        Parameters:
        context - the current context

    • Method Detail

      • login

        public void login​(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  VolleyRespInterface callback)
        LOGIN Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the login is complete the callback will be passed the token or a negative number if the login failed
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        password - the password of the user
        callback - the callback to be called when the login is complete
        Implementation Note:
        the callback is returned as a string, so it must be parsed to an int

      • login

        public void login​(java.lang.String username,
                  java.lang.String password)
        NOCALLBACKLOGIN void method that logs in without a callback generally don't use this, but it's here if you must for some reason ie testing
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        password - the password of the user

      • logout

        public void logout​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        LOGOUT Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the logout is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the logout is complete
        Implementation Note:
        the callback is returned as a string boolean, true if the logout was successful

      • logout

        public void logout()
        NOCALLBACKLOGOUT void method that logs out without a callback generally don't use this, but it's here if you must for some reason ie testing

      • register

        public void register​(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     VolleyRespInterface callback)
        REGISTER Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the register is complete the callback will be passed the token or a negative number if the register failed
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user
        password - the password of the user
        callback - the callback to be called when the register is complete
        Implementation Note:
        MAKE SURE TO CHECK THAT BOTH PASSWORD FIELDS MATCH BEFORE CALLING THIS METHOD
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, so it must be parsed to an int

      • isLoggedIn

        public void isLoggedIn​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        IS LOGGED IN Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the is logged in is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the is logged in is complete
        Implementation Note:
        the callback is returned as a string, so it must be parsed to a boolean
        Callback:
        the callback will be passed true if the user is logged in, false otherwise

        public void getCurrentPublicUserData​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        Get Current Public User Data Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the get current public user data is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the get current public user data is complete
        Callback:
        the callback will be passed a Json String that can be parsed into a Profile object

      • getRestaurants

        public java.util.List<Restaurant> getRestaurants()
        GET RESTAURANTS Semi Synchronous method that returns the restaurants,
        Returns:
        the restaurants list
        Implementation Note:
        Restaurant list is Asyncronously built when the class is initialized, so this method will return null if the list is not yet built

      • getRestaurantsAsync

        public void getRestaurantsAsync​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET RESTAURANTS ASYNC
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the restaurants is complete
        Implementation Note:
        Call if get restaurants returns null Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the restaurants is complete Once the callback returns true, the restaurants list can be accessed, using getRestaurants()
        Callback:
        the callback will be passed a String: true if the data was successfully retrieved, false otherwise

      • getRestaurantsAsync

        public void getRestaurantsAsync()
        NOCALLBACKGETRESTAURANTSASYNC void method that gets restaurants async without a callback generally don't use this, but it's here if you must // only use this if you need to load restaurants data manually

      • getAllFoodDataAsync

        public void getAllFoodDataAsync​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET ALL FOOD DATA FROM SERVER Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the all food data is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the all food data is complete
        Callback:
        the callback will be passed the String true if the data was successfully retrieved, false otherwise

      • getAllFoodDataAsync

        public void getAllFoodDataAsync()
        NOCALLBACKGETALLFOODDATAASYNC void method that gets all food data async without a callback generally don't use this, but it's here if you must // only use this if you need to load food data manually

      • getRestaurantsOpenNow

        public void getRestaurantsOpenNow​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET RESTAURANTS OPEN NOW Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the restaurants open now is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the restaurants open now is complete
        Implementation Note:
        the callback is returned as a string, so it must be parsed to an int array
        Callback:
        the callback will be passed an empty array if there are no restaurants open
        Recommendation
        I recommend removing the surrounding brackets and splitting on the commas ie "[1,2,3]" to "1,2,3" then "1,2,3".split(","), I also recommend removing all whitespace from the string using .replaceAll("\\s+","")

      • getRestaurant

        public Restaurant getRestaurant​(int id)
        GET RESTAURANT Semi Synchronous method that returns the restaurant, Restaurant list is Asyncronously built when the class is initialized (see getRestaurantsAsync)
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the restaurant to be returned
        Returns:
        the restaurant with the given id, null if the restaurant does not exist or if the restaurant list has not been built yet

      • getFoods

        public java.util.List<Food> getFoods​(int restaurantId)
        GET FOODS Semi Synchronous method that returns the foods, Food Map is Asyncronously built when the class is initialized
        Parameters:
        restaurantId - the id of the restaurant whos food list is to be returned
        Returns:
        the list of foods associated with the given restaurant, null if the restaurant does not exist or if the food list has not been built yet

      • getFoodsCurrentlyAvailable

        public void getFoodsCurrentlyAvailable​(int restaurantId,
                                       VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET FOODS CURRENTLY AVAILABLE Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the foods currently available is complete
        Parameters:
        restaurantId - the id of the restaurant whos current food list is to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the foods currently available is complete
        Implementation Note:
        I recommend removing the surrounding brackets and splitting on the commas ie "[1,2,3]" to "1,2,3" then "1,2,3".split(","), I also recommend removing all whitespace from the string using .replaceAll("\\s+","")
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, so it must be parsed to an int array, the callback will be passed an empty array if there are no foods currently available

      • getHoursListing

        public void getHoursListing​(int restaurantId,
                            VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET HOURS LISTING Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the hours listing is complete
        Parameters:
        restaurantId - the id of the restaurant whos hours listing is to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the hours listing is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, either a formatted string of the hours listing or false if there is no hours listing or error if there is an error

      • getHoursListing

        public void getHoursListing​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET HOURS LISTING Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the hours listing is complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the hours listing is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, the callback is returned true if the hours listing was successfully updated. false if interupted, and error if error

      • getFood

        public Food getFood​(int id)
        GET FOOD Semi Synchronous method that returns the food, Food Map is Asyncronously built when the class is initialized, so this method will return null if the food map has not been built yet
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the food to be returned
        Returns:
        the food with the given id, or null if the food map has not been built yet

      • getReviewsByFood

        public void getReviewsByFood​(int foodId,
                             VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET REVIEWS FOR FOOD Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the reviews is complete
        Parameters:
        foodId - the id of the food whos reviews are to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the reviews are complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, I have included a method to parse it to a list of reviews see parseReviews(String reviewArrayAsString) below, the callback is returned a string that is a json Array of reviews, see parseReviews(String reviewArrayAsString) below, on error the callback is returned an empty array

      • getReviewsByFoodPartial

        public void getReviewsByFoodPartial​(int foodId,
                                    int index,
                                    int size,
                                    VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET REVIEWS PARTIAL FOR FOOD Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the reviews partial is complete
        Parameters:
        foodId - the id of the food whos reviews are to be returned
        index - the index of the first review to be returned
        size - the number of reviews to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the reviews are complete
        Implementation Note:
        the index and size are used to get a partial list of reviews ie index 0, size 10 will get the first 10 reviews, index 10, size 10 will get reviews 11-20
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, I have included a method to parse it to a list of reviews see parseReviews(String reviewArrayAsString) below

      • addReview

        public void addReview​(double score,
                      java.lang.String reviewBody,
                      int foodId,
                      VolleyRespInterface callback)
        ADD REVIEW Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the add review is complete
        Parameters:
        score - the score of the review
        reviewBody - the body of the review
        foodId - the id of the food the review is for
        callback - the callback to be called when the add review is complete
        Callback:
        callback is returned a boolean indicating if the review was added as a string

      • addReview

        public void addReview​(double score,
                      java.lang.String reviewBody,
                      int foodId)
        NOCALLBACK ADD REVIEW Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the add review is complete
        Parameters:
        score - the score of the review
        reviewBody - the body of the review
        foodId - the id of the food the review is for
        Implementation Note:
        this method is bad practice, but I have included it for convenience and testing, it is deprecated and should not be used, review adding status should alway be checked

      • addReview

        @Deprecated
public void addReview​(Review review,
                      VolleyRespInterface callback)
        Deprecated.
        This method is deprecated, use the ones above instead, the review shouldn't be created outside of the database like this Reason: review objects are too verbose for the request, much of the data is created on the server
        ADD REVIEW Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the add review is complete
        Parameters:
        review - the review to be added
        callback - the callback to be called when the add review is complete

        Parameters:
        userId - the id of the user whos reviews are to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the user reviews are complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, I have included a method to parse it to a list of reviews see parseReviews(String reviewArrayAsString) below

      • getReviewsByUserIdPartial

        public void getReviewsByUserIdPartial​(int userId,
                                      int index,
                                      int size,
                                      VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET USER REVIEWS PARTIAL Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the user reviews partial is complete
        Parameters:
        userId - the id of the user whos reviews are to be returned
        index - the index of the first review to be returned
        size - the number of reviews to be returned
        callback - the callback to be called when the user reviews partial is complete
        Implementation Note:
        the index and size are used to get a partial list of reviews ie index 0, size 10 will get the first 10 reviews, index 10, size 10 will get reviews 11-20
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, I have included a method to parse it to a list of reviews see parseReviews(String reviewArrayAsString) below

      • deleteReview

        public void deleteReview​(int reviewId,
                         VolleyRespInterface callback)
        Delete USER REVIEW Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the delete user review is complete
        Parameters:
        reviewId - the id of the review to be deleted
        callback - the callback to be called when the delete user review is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned boolean indicating if the review was deleted as a string

      • deleteReview

        public void deleteReview​(int reviewId)
        NOCALLBACK DELETE USER REVIEW Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the delete user review is complete, this should not be used, it is only here for testing, always check if the review was deleted
        Parameters:
        reviewId - the id of the review to be deleted

      • getAllDataAsync

        public void getAllDataAsync​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET ALL DATA ASYNC Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the get all data is complete This method is used to get all the data at once, and is used to populate the database
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the get all data is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned a string containing either "error" or true or false depending on if the data was retrieved and parsed correctly

      • getAllDataAsync

        public void getAllDataAsync()
        NOCALLBACK GET ALL DATA ASYNC Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the get all data is complete could be used to manually populate the database

      • parseReviews

        public java.util.List<Review> parseReviews​(java.lang.String reviewsArr)
        PARSE REVIEWS Synchronous method that returns a list of reviews from a string
        Parameters:
        reviewsArr - the string containing the JSONArray of reviews
        Returns:
        a list of reviews

      • updateAllData

        public void updateAllData​(lDate date,
                          VolleyRespInterface callback)
        UPDATE ALL DATA Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the update all data is complete
        Parameters:
        date - is the ldate of the last update
        callback - the callback to be called when the update all data is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, it will be a json object with 2 arrays of restaurants and foods as json objects on failure the callback will return an empty {} json object

      • updateAllData

        public void updateAllData​(lDate date)
        NO CALLBACK UPDATE ALL DATA Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the update all data is complete
        Parameters:
        date - is the ldate of the last update

      • updateAllRestaurants

        public void updateAllRestaurants​(lDate date,
                                 VolleyRespInterface callback)
        UPDATE ALL RESTAURANTS Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the update all restaurants is complete
        Parameters:
        date - is the ldate of the last update
        callback - the callback to be called when the update all restaurants is complete
        Implementation Note:
        this method is the same as updateAllData, but it only returns the restaurants that were updated
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, it will be a json array of restaurants as json objects on failure the callback will return an empty [] json array

      • updateAllFoods

        public void updateAllFoods​(lDate date,
                           VolleyRespInterface callback)
        UPDATE ALL FOODS Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the update all foods is complete
        Parameters:
        date - is the ldate of the last update
        callback - the callback to be called when the update all foods is complete
        Implementation Note:
        this method is the same as updateAllData, but it only returns the foods that were updated
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, it will be a json array of foods as json objects on failure the callback will return an empty [] json array

      • reviewDelete

        public void reviewDelete​(int reviewId,
                         VolleyRespInterface callback)
        REVIEW DELETE Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the review delete is complete
        Parameters:
        reviewId - is the id of the review to delete
        callback - the callback to be called when the review delete is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, true if the review was deleted, false if it wasn't

      • reviewDelete

        public void reviewDelete​(int reviewId)
        NO CALLBACK REVIEW DELETE Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the review delete is complete, Genrally don't use this method, it is only here for testing, always check if review was deleted
        Parameters:
        reviewId - is the id of the review to delete

      • userBlacklist

        public void userBlacklist​(int userId,
                          boolean blacklist,
                          VolleyRespInterface callback)
        USER BLACKLIST Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the user blacklist is complete
        Parameters:
        userId - is the id of the user to blacklist
        blacklist - is true if the user should be blacklisted, false if they should be unblacklisted
        callback - the callback to be called when the user blacklist is complete
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, true if the user was blacklisted, false if it wasn't

      • userBlacklist

                          boolean blacklist)

        Parameters:
        userId - is the id of the user to blacklist
        blacklist - is true if the user should be blacklisted, false if they should be unblacklisted

      • userDelete

        public void userDelete​(int userId)
        NO CALLBACK USER DELETE Asynchronous method that doens't call the callback when the user delete is complete Genrally don't use this method, it is only here for testing, always check if user was deleted
        Parameters:
        userId - is the id of the user to delete

      • getRecommendedFoods

        public void getRecommendedFoods​(VolleyRespInterface callback)
        GET RECOMMENDED FOODS Asynchronous method that calls the callback when the recommended foods are complete
        Parameters:
        callback - the callback to be called when the recommended foods are complete
        Implementation Note:
        I recommend removing the surrounding brackets and splitting on the commas ie "[1,2,3]" to "1,2,3" then "1,2,3".split(","), I also recommend removing all whitespace from the string using .replaceAll("\\s+","")
        Callback:
        the callback is returned as a string, it will be a json array of food ids on failure the callback will return an empty [] json array

      • getStorageInterface

        public StorageInterface getStorageInterface()
        GET STORAGE INTERFACE FOR DIRECT ACCESS TO THE CACHE OBJECT USE WITH CAUTION
        Returns:
        the storage interface object

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        CLEAR CACHE Clears the cache and the storage interface and the restaurants and foods

      • getCacheSize

        public java.lang.String getCacheSize()
        GET CACHE SIZE
        Returns:
        the size of the cache as a string formatted to the nearest scalar size ie 1.2kb, 1.2mb, 1.2gb

      • getCacheDate

        public lDate getCacheDate()
        GET CACHE DATE
        Returns:
        the date the cache was last updated
